auto_merge.commit_message:
Also simplify the "rhs_scope" logic in FlowControl.py. It's now always
set, rather than special-cased for loops explicitly.

Fixes #6547

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Also simplify the "rhs_scope" logic in FlowControl.py. It's now always set, rather than special-cased for loops explicitly.

Fixes #6547

comment_data.body:
The only place that I could find for this is `NameNode.type_dependencies()`, which does `env.lookup()`:
```python
    def type_dependencies(self, env):
        if self.entry is None:
            self.entry = env.lookup(self.name)
```
The only scope that creates a new `Entry` in `lookup()` seems to be the `LocalScope`, for closure entries. I would have expected those to be initialised at this point. I know, this PR is a year old, but do you remember running into iteration failures here? Possibly with the tests that you added? They seem to process ok with the current master branch.

```suggestion
        # Make a copy because type_dependencies() can create new entries (in closures).
        for name, entry in scope.entries.copy().items():
```

I'm mostly asking because this seems like an unrelated "I ran into this along the way and added a fix" kind of change. I'm trying to find out if this can be avoided earlier. Although given the potential side-effects of name lookups, this change is probably just fine and what it takes.

I agree - this doesn't seem like it breaks anything if I remove it right now. (it also seems fine if I go back to the older version before you merged the current master in)

I don't remember much of the detail at the moment. I'll have a look and see if I can come up with an example where this breaks though. It's certainly possible that this was only needed for an earlier version of the change.

I can't immediately find a way to break it.

I suspect this was just something I ran into at an intermediate stage. It certainly feels like you should only hit is variables have been mis-assigned earlier.

I think I'll remove it for now.

commit.message:
Fix some assignment expression scoping

Also simplify the "rhs_scope" logic in FlowControl.py. It's now
always set, rather than special-cased for loops explicitly.

Fixes #6547
